ugp.org.SerialX.Protocols

Class SelfSerializableProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • ugp.org.SerialX.Protocols.SerializationProtocol<SelfSerializable>
      • ugp.org.SerialX.Protocols.SelfSerializableProtocol

  • public class SelfSerializableProtocol
extends SerializationProtocol<SelfSerializable>
    SelfSerializableProtocol is universal protocol to serialize any SelfSerializable instance. The condition of use is implementation of SelfSerializable interface and public constructor that can be called with content returned by specific SelfSerializable.serialize()!
    Since:
    1.2.2
    Author:
    PETO

        public java.lang.Object[] serialize(SelfSerializable object)
        Specified by:
        serialize in class SerializationProtocol<SelfSerializable>
        Parameters:
        object - | The object.

      • unserialize

        public SelfSerializable unserialize(java.lang.Class<? extends SelfSerializable> objectClass,
                                    java.lang.Object... args)
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        Specified by:
        unserialize in class SerializationProtocol<SelfSerializable>
        Parameters:
        objectClass - | The class of object that should be created. This can be useful when object T has children classes with same constructors. You can use reflection to make protocol working also for these child classes!
        args - | Args to create obj T from.
        Returns:
        New instance of object T created from args.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - you can just pass exception to Serializer if you are not interested in handling it on your own.

      • applicableFor

        public java.lang.Class<? extends SelfSerializable> applicableFor()
        Specified by:
        applicableFor in class SerializationProtocol<SelfSerializable>
        Returns:
        Class that can be serialized using this protocol. In other words it should return class of object T
